direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 1 - 4)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: The elements interchange positions in the ordersandalternately.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 1 - 4)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: The symbols move in the sequencein the first step. In each subsequent step, the symbols move in the sequence obtained by rotating the previous sequence through 90oACW. Also, in each step, the symbol that reaches the encircled position gets replaced by a new one.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 1 - 4)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: The number of parts increases by one along with the number of sides in the figure.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 1 - 4)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: The upper-left element gets laterally inverted in first, third, fifth. .... steps; the upper-right element gets rotated through 180ois first, fourth, seventh,.... steps; the lower-left element gets laterally inverted in second, fourth, sixth, ... steps; the lower-right element gets rotated through 180oin third, sixth,... steps and the pin at the middle-right position gets laterally inverted in every second step.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 5 - 6)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: The number of 'L' shaped elements in the upper part of the figure increases by one in every second step. Also, in each step, the existing 'L' shaped elements rotate 90oCW; the lower two elements interchange positions and the element that reaches the lower left corner, gets replaced by a new one.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 5 - 6)Each of the following questions consists of five figures marked A, B, C, D and E called the Problem Figures followed by five other figures marked 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 called the Answer Figures. Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.
question: Select a figure from amongst the Answer Figures which will continue the same series as established by the five Problem Figures.Problem Figures:                          Answer Figures:(A)     (B)     (C)     (D)     (E)       (1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: In the first step, the V sign moves half-a-side of the square boundary in an ACW direction; in the second step, the black circle moves half-a-side of the square boundary in an ACW direction and in the third step, the triangle moves half-a-side of the square boundary in an ACW direction. The three steps are repeated to continue the series.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 7 - 9)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. Establish a similar relationship between figures C and D by selecting a suitable figure from the Answer Set that would replace the question mark (?) in fig. (D).
question: Select a suitable figure from the Answer Figures that would replace the question mark (?).Problem Figures:                            Answer Figures:(A)     (B)      (C)     (D)                  (1)      (2)      (3)      (4)      (5)
answer_description: The figure gets vertically inverted and the two vertical lines inside the figure get rotated through 90o.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 7 - 9)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. Establish a similar relationship between figures C and D by selecting a suitable figure from the Answer Set that would replace the question mark (?) in fig. (D).
question: Select a suitable figure from the Answer Figures that would replace the question mark (?).Problem Figures:                            Answer Figures:(A)     (B)      (C)     (D)                  (1)      (2)      (3)      (4)      (5)
answer_description: The half-arrow rotates 90oACW and gets laterally inverted and moves to the adjacent side of the square boundary in a CW direction. The bent pin rotates 90oACW and moves to the adjacent side of the square boundary in a CW direction.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 7 - 9)Each of the following questions consists of two sets of figures. Figures A, B, C and D constitute the Problem Set while figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 constitute the Answer Set. There is a definite relationship between figures A and B. question: Select a suitable figure from the Answer Figures that would replace the question mark (?).Problem Figures:                            Answer Figures:(A)     (B)      (C)     (D)                  (1)      (2)      (3)      (4)      (5)
answer_description: The outer element reduces in size; get vertically inverted and becomes the inner element. The inner element gets enlarged and becomes the outer element. The small element attached to upper end of the figure, gets vertically inverted and moves to the lower end of the figure.

answer_description: The outer element rotates I35oCW and the inner element rotates 135oACW.

answer_description: The black leaf rotates 135oACW and white leaf rotates 90oACW

answer_description: The number of sides of the central figure increases by one and the number of line segments attached to the central figure decreases by one.

answer_description: The figure rotates through 135oACW.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 14 - 19)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: In fig. (3), the arrow indicates an ACW motion while in each of the other figures, the arrow indicates a CW motion.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 14 - 19)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: All other figures can be rotated into each other.

question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: In each one of the figures, except fig. (2), the number of sides in the inner element is one more than the number of sides in the outer element.

direction: Direction (Q.Nos. 14 - 19)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)

question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)

direction: Direction (Q.No. 20)In each problem, out of the five figures marked (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5), four are similar in a certain manner. However, one figure is not like the other four. Choose the figure which is different from the rest.
question: Choose the figure which is different from the rest.(1)     (2)     (3)     (4)     (5)
answer_description: In each one of the other figures, the small line segment lies one space ahead of the dot, in a CW direction.
